result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr, Esquire

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher R Yarbro in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Christopher R Yarbro. Case joined in trial with 21CT452. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Exhibit #1 attached. Not received by the Court.

3:32 PM (64-06) Defendant Christopher R Yarbro appeared in court, Attorney Mackenzie Renner for Christopher R Yarbro appeared in court, Attorney J J. Crawford for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
State called to the stand as a witness Deputy of Walworth County S.O.,  Mitchell Stocking.
Mitchell Stocking duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA J.J. Crawford. Witness has identified the defendant in court. 
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court. Exhibit #1 offered, Attorney Renner objects, subject to cross. 
3:36 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Renner.
Evidence is closed.
3:43 PM - Argument by ADA Crawford.
3:44 PM - Argument by Attorney Renner.
Exhibit #1 not received by the court.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Renner acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading. Plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of her client.
Reserved Speedy.
Attorney Renner is requesting 60 days for a Status Hearing.
Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER 22CF49 AND 21CT542

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant

CASH POSTED 11-12-21
